data.title: Good food
data.text: Good European food coming in big portions and for really good prices.wish to be more servers on weekends otherwise you need to wait for service

data.title: Not just poor service ...
data.text: Well i invited my wife to Mehanata and really expected to be a great experience but... theres no light at the patio so  I could hardly read the menu. when we got there i was confused where to park. than we were seated and waited way to long for placing the order. Food was just fine except i had literally 4 french fires in my mechanata sach. in the meantime waitress didnt even ask if everything was ok or anything. We understood that it was pretty busy but there are some standards...looked like she didnt care about us at all. At the end after waiting another 10 mins for a check we realized that the club soda is for $1.50a glass. We had 4 of them so for $6 i could easily bring a bottle or two  of Perrier or Pellegino instead of club soda from the gun... Anyway the service was way below average food was just ok nothing special. What we liked was that on the menu you can see everything on the picture as well as online. Thats very convenient and was actually cool...So im not even sure that id like to come back there during a daylight and being helped by another server. That is a below average restaurant

data.title: First timers
data.text: 4first timers. Parking confusing. Once we knew could park at auto body lot it was OK. Menu great,non-Bulgarians can see pictures of everything on menu!Service great,food very good. Shared salads (shopska) delicious and chicken soup good. Main entrees all good (sausage, pork, chicken). Negative was music a little loud.

data.title: Tasty Bulgarian food- family style
data.text:
We were a group of five friends, three of whom had never eaten Bulgarian food. The service was excellent, the food was tasty- almost as good as being in Bulgaria itself ( difference in taste only due to the fact the food was not all sourced from Bulgaria).

I recommend sharing all appetisers and entrees.

data.title: High quality food, great atmosphere!!!
data.text: I love the fried zucchini, tarator, and mixed grill. Its not very cheap but the quality of food is great. Avoid Saturday night or even daytime...every single table is "reserved" but other than that its very nice quick service. Great for B-Day party or just good quality lunch or dinner.

data.title: Very impressed
data.text: Went with couple buddies, recommended to try.  Was not disappointed at all. Food was very good and had beer, that never had loved it.

data.title: Good food .
data.text: Great area restaurant, very friendly people.for sure we will be back soon and very nice terrace. We always had great service and good food

data.title: Delightful!
data.text: The food was excellent and authentic, the staff was friendly and the atmosphere - cozy. The primary language spoken in this restaurant is Bulgarian but the menu is in English and has a lot of pictures to help your choice.

data.title: Best possible bulgarian kitchen in US
data.text: This is Bulgarian island in US. People there speak Bulgarian and English. Cuisine is Bulgarian, but there is steak and fries too. If you like Balkan food, this is place for you. portions are big and the food taste very good. Reasonable prices, too.
